You look at Mr. Jones and laugh, “You can’t be serious? I need to….”

Mr. Jones points to the new contract, “You updated your contract to abide to being treated like your new body. Now be a good little girl and listen to Mommy!”

You take a deep breath realizing Mr. Jones is serious. You wish you would have actually read the updated contract before signing it. You nervously follow her into the bathroom and wonder, “What did I get myself into?”
11521.title: "Okay, sure. This might be fun."

choices: Meeting up with the wedding party
115211.content:
You aren’t sure what to expect anymore after signing the new body Port agreement. On one hand, you are glad to have the help getting your new body ready for the wedding. Without the help of your new Mom, you wouldn’t have any idea how to do hair or get dressed. She was already helpful this morning helping you put your hair into a neat pony tail. On the other hand, you are still mad that you missed going out with your friends you haven’t seen since college. You knew all the guys were going to the strip clubs last night. Given you were in the body of an 8 year old girl, you wouldn’t have been to go along anyway.

After breakfast, you sit in front of the TV and turn on ESPN. Your Mom grabs the remote and changes the channel to Nickelodeon. “Hey! I was watching that!” You try to tell her.

Mom says, “There is inappropriate language on that channel. You need to watch something more your age.”

You shake your head, “Oh. This must be part of the updated contract huh? What am I supposed to do all morning then?”

“I’m trying to figure that out right now.” Mom explains, “I’m looking at this family’s calendar to see what they normally do.”

You point out, “Wait a second? I’m not here to live this girl’s life for her! I came here for my friend’s wedding.”

Mom agrees, “You are right Stephanie. According to the contract you are able to attend every required event dealing with the wedding. But by signing it, you consented to maintaining Stephanie’s lifestyle. It’s not just you though. This also means I have to keep up her mother’s regular schedule too.“

You joke, “So if this wasn’t the middle of the summer, I would have to go to school for Stephanie?”

“Yes. You have to remember. Most people who sign this type of agreement enjoy living someone else‘s life for a vacation.”

After reading the wedding itinerary, Mom explains, “It says that there is an afternoon social today. It is at the father of the bride’s home starting at 3.“ Mom noted, “That means we will have to find Stephanie’s swimsuit. It says it is a pool party.”

You roll your eyes hearing you will be wearing Stephanie’s swimsuit. You nod, “Oh, that’s right. I forgot about the pool party . But isn’t there anything before that? I’d like to hang out with my friends for a bit.“

Mom shook her head, “It looks like the bachelor party was last night. I’m sure all of your friends are hung over and wont be getting up until after noon. That’s probably why they scheduled it so late.”

“So what do we do until then? It’s only 8am?”

Mom finished reading the family calendar and sighed, “Hmm…It says here that my body goes to a yoga class in the gym at 9.”

You laugh, “Ha ha! Looks like you will be doing some working out while I‘m home watching TV!”

Mom then explained, “Not exactly. It says here that Stephanie’s summer gymnastics class also starts at 9. They obviously scheduled it so they could go to the gym together.”

Your eyes get wide, “Gymnastics? You can’t be serious! I‘m not prancing around with a bunch of girls!”

As Mom walked towards Stephanie’s bedroom, she cracked a smile, “Remember, you are contractually obligated to do everything their normal bodies would!” She came back shortly with an article of clothing and handed it to you, “You better put this on! We need to leave in 10 minutes!”

You held a leotard in your hands and rolled your eyes. You hold it up to your body and groaned. It was baby blue with a small attached skirt. Sparkles ran down the neckline. “Ok! This is enough! I appreciated the help with getting my body ready, but this is too much! I want to go back to the old contract!”

Mom shook her head, “Trust me. I wish we could! I hate yoga! I’m not thrilled about this either. But the contract you signed last night cant be altered for 5 business days. Unfortunately, the only other option would be to terminate the contract. But that would mean you would immediately body port home. And since somebody else is currently utilizing your original body, you would be body ported into the first available body on a temporary basis until yours was returned. Then you would incur a mandatory 20,000 dollar fine for replanting you back into your original body. You would be banned for life at the Body Port Inc. Not to mention that would also mean you’d miss the wedding.”

Realizing she was right, you held up the leotard and groaned, “I may as well get this over with!” You walked into Stephanie’s bedroom to change. Mom added, “Look at the bright side! Gymnastics might be fun! You will probably do some interesting spins and jumps!”

You laugh back and sarcastically reply, “Yipee!”

“Oh. And one more thing!” Mom looks at you with a serious look, “I’ve been pretty relaxed this morning with your demeanor. I understand this is taking some getting used to. However, periodically the Body Port company sends out disguised agents to monitor our behavior. It’s kind of like an auditing system to ensure we are doing our jobs correctly. They could be monitoring us at any time. So from now on, you need to clean up your language and stop those sassy remarks. A normal daughter would never get away with talking to her mother like that. I am supposed to treat you like the body you are in. I don’t want to jeopardize my career over you. I’ll have to discipline you like Stephanie’s real mother would if you act up. You are a bit old for swatting, but I have the authority to ground you if I deem it appropriate. You don’t want to risk missing the wedding do you Stephanie?”

You take a deep breath realizing how serious the Body Port company was. You would hate to get grounded and miss the wedding. You are really regretting signing the updated contract.

Mom asks, “Do you understand Stephanie?”

You decide to comply with Mom and almost over-act your role. You give a huge fake smile and reply with the cutest voice you can muster, “Yes Mommy. I understand!”

Mom cant help crack a smile at the way you answered. She ends with, “Watch that sarcasm too young lady!”

You laugh back, “Oopsie! Sorry about that!”
115211.title: The next morning

1152112.content:
After managing to get Stephanie’s leotard mostly on, you meet Mom in the living room. She also changed and has yoga pants with a tank on.

You tell her, “That was a bit more difficult than I imagined! This leotard is so tight it feels like a second skin!”

Mom nodded, “That’s good. That means nothing is baggy and wont get in the way.”

You turn your back to her and say, “I couldn’t quite get these tricky neckline snaps. Can you help me out?”

You turn your back so Mom can snap them for you. You then joke, “I think I know why it takes girls forever to go to the bathroom now. It’s going to take me forever to get this thing off when I have to pee.”

Mom shakes her head, “I keep forgetting this is your Body Port into a female body. You don’t have to take your leotard off to pee. The same goes for swimsuits. All you have to do is sit down and pull the material aside.“

“Oh…” You feel stupid for not realizing that. You say, “So what are girls doing in the bathroom for so long then?“

Mom explains, “Lots of things. Luckily you aren’t old enough to worry about some of them. Unlike boys, girls don’t just pee and leave the bathroom. There’s always touchups to be made and hair adjustments…” Mom then looked at you and realized, “Speaking of that, we better do something with your hair. You can‘t have it down like that for gymnastics! If we don‘t put it up, it will get in your way..“

You follow Mom to her vanity and sit down. She thinks out loud for a moment, “Hmmm…Your hair is pretty long…A pony will fling around too much…“ She then starts pulling your hair back tight, “Ouch!” You say as she tugs it back.

Mom explains, “Relax. I have to pull it back tight for your French braid. That way you wont have any loose hair dangling out.”

You sit for 10 minutes while she braids your hair. After securing it with a tight rubber band, she hands you a mirror so you can see the back of your head. “Cool! Nice job Mom!” You tell her as you admire her work. “This is much better than having all that hair in my face!” You then suggest, “Can you do these braids for me on the wedding day too?”

Mom shook her head no, “This style isn’t nearly fancy enough for a wedding. I’m not sure what the stylist is going to do with all the girl’s hair, but it definitely wont be a French braid.”

“Stylist?” You question

“You seem to have a problem with reading up on things?” Mom was of course referring to the fact you neglected to read the Body Port contract AND the wedding itinerary. She continued, “All the women in the wedding are getting their hair done early Saturday morning. You will have to join them considering your current body.”

You were hoping to hang out with the other groomsman before the wedding. You hadn’t realized you would spending the morning getting your hair done with the other girls. You then ask, “Even though I‘m technically a groomsman, a tux is obviously out of the question with this body. Do you think I‘ll have to wear a bridesmaid dress to match the other women?”

Mom shrugs her shoulders, “I’m not sure what they have planned for you. Just like you, most of the wedding party Body Ported in for the occasion. You will be attending a dress fitting with the other women tomorrow morning at 9. I presume you will learn what the plan is then.”

Looking at the clock, Mom sees it is time to leave. You put shoes on and start following her towards the door. Mom looks up and down your body and cracks a smile. She barely manages to hold back her laughter.

You suddenly feel self conscious, “Okay? What’s so funny?”

Mom explains, “I’m sorry for laughing. That was unprofessional of me. As an employee of Body Port Inc, I’m supposed to help guide you with your vacation. I just keep forgetting this is your first time in a female body.”

After hearing her, it was obvious you were making a mistake. “Okay..What do I need to do?“

Mom got her composure back and explains, “For starters, you are wearing a beautiful blue leotard with a pair of knee-high white athletic socks….And a pair of big clunky red sneakers.”

You look down and see what she is talking about. Your look ridiculous with your outfit.

She continues, “Actually…That’s not your biggest concern. Girls don’t typically drive around and walk through parking lots wearing only a leotard. You might get some funny looks. You’ll need to pull on a pair of light pants and a top over it.”

You start walking towards Stephanie’s bedroom to find the articles of clothing. Mom adds, “And lose those socks and shoes. A pair of sandals with your bare feet will be fine!”

You follow her instructions and come out properly dressed. Mom is pleased, “MUCH better Stephanie. We better get going! You don’t want to be late for class!”

Even though you are about to attend a girl’s gymnastics class, you are somewhat relieved Mom helped you with the details. You laugh thinking about the funny stories you will have to tell your friends when you meet up with them tonight. They will probably get a good laugh about hearing how you went to Stephanie’s gymnastics class for her.

As you get into the car, you tell Mom, “NOW I’m starting to understand why it takes girls so long to get ready!”

Mom just grinned and thought to herself, “She has no idea!”
1152112.title: Getting ready for Stephanie's gymnastics class

choices: With the girls at the dress fitting
1153.content:
You call them on the way to tell them you've arrived and to explain what happened.

When you arrive David and His Fiancé Amy let you in.

"Well, I knew none of my groomsmen would look like themselves now that we all live apart, but I didn't expect any little girls!" David chuckled.

Amy added, “I guess that's what you get for buying a last minute ticket.”

You look up to them and ask, "So what should we do? Do you want your best man in a dress? Or should I get a tux? Is there time for this before the wedding?"

"Oh don't worry about that! Ever since these body ports have become commonplace, people always get dresses and Tuxes only days before the Wedding, It would be easiest if you just matched the rest of the bridesmaids. But since they don’t make my bridesmaid dresses that small, I have a better idea. You can wear a matching flower girl dress that my niece Amanda is going to wear!”

You look up surprised, “Flower Girl? I’m the best man! Not a flower girl!”

Amy agrees, “Relax. You are still the best man! You can still stand on David’s side. But they don’t make my bridesmaid dresses that small. Plus, it will be better for the pictures if you matched Amanda’s dress.


"Allright" you reply not excited by the thought of wearing a dress designed for a flower girl.


Amy then tells you, “You were the last of the wedding party to arrive. I was about to get all the girls to get dresses fitted, and David was getting the guys Tuxes. But for now, I guess your with me" Amy said as she grabs your hand.
1153.title: Mr. Jones takes you to David and Amis house

11531.content:
As Amy leads you into the dress fitting with the other bridesmaids, a little girl about 5 years old comes running up. The girls smiles, “Hi! I’m Amanda!”

You look at the flower girl dress she has on and realize you will soon have a matching one. You reply, “It’s nice to meet you. I’m John!”

Amanda looks at you funny, “John? That’s a funny girl’s name?”

From across the room, you hear a bridesmaid say, “John? Wow! That’s really you?”

Amy nods for you and explains, “Yea it’s really him. John decided to wait until the last minute to book a teleport ticket!”

Another Bridesmaid came up to John with a smirk. You don’t recognize the woman as she says, “Hey John! Remember me? I’m Susie! I like in California now and had to use a teleport to get here too!”

You suddenly get a lump in your throat hearing the woman announce herself as ‘Susie.’ Susie is Amy’s sister that you slept with in high school. You look up at her and reply, “Hi Susie…Its nice to see you again..”

Susie winks as she whispers, “It’s too bad you ended up as an 8 year old girl. I was hoping we could rekindle some memories from high school. I guess that’s not possible now.”

You kick yourself realizing if you would have teleported into ANY guys body that you would have slept with Susie tonight.

Before you know it, a seamstress comes over and guides you to a mirror. The woman quickly takes off your shirt and pants and makes you slide into a pair of white tights. Next she pulls a flower girl dress over your head. As you look in the mirror, you see how wide the dress seems to flare out. It only goes to about your knees and has a big bow in the back. As the seamstress ties the bow and buttons the back of the dress up, she smiles, “We lucked out on this one! No alterations are required. It fits her perfect!”

Amy is relieved that the dress won’t need altering. Amy then starts walking around to the other bridesmaids to see how their dress altering are going.

The seamstress then starts pinning your hair up as you wonder what she is doing. She then puts a matching tiara on your head, just like Amanda has. She spends 10 minutes adjusting the tiara so it will fit you perfect. She tells you to check with Amy to see if Amy approves.

You walk over to Amy and ask, “Well? How do I look?”

Amy smiles as she sees how pretty you look with the dress on. Amy then notices the tiara and smiles, “Wow! The tiara looks really cute! But I was planning on only having Amanda wear one since she is really the flower girl”

The seamstress apologizes, “I’m sorry. I just figured this young lady was a second flower girl. I figured she would need a tiara too….I will go ahead and take it off your bill.”

As the seamstress starts to remove the tiara, Amy interjects, “Wait! On second thought, I really like the way it looks! I think John should wear a matching tiara too with that dress!”

The seamstress cracks a smile, “John?”

You look up at the seamstress and nod, “Yea…I’m normally a guy. I’m actually the best man. It’s a long story…I had a mix up with the teleporter…”

The seamstress just smiled, “Two tiaras it is then…”
11531.title: With the girls at the dress fitting

115311.content:
At the wedding rehearsal, you stand with David at the back of the church with the rest of the groomsman. One of groomsman jokes, “Tough break about your body John. You are going to miss some great strippers tonight at the bachelor party!”

You roll your eyes knowing you aren’t old enough to go along to the bars tonight with David and the groomsman.

The wedding coordinator comes up and starts explaining the walkthrough of the wedding. The wedding coordinator starts pairing up bridesmaids with groomsman to walk down the aisle with. You notice the maid of honor has been paired up with a groomsman and you interrupt the wedding coordinator, “Uh..Excuse me..but I’m the best man. Shouldn’t I walk down the aisle with the maid of honor?”

The wedding coordinator looked down at you confused. She wondered why an 8 year old girl was claiming to be the best man. Amy quickly interjected, “It’s true! There was a mix up with his teleport.”

Once the wedding coordinator understood what happened, she explained, “That’s ok..This sort of thing happens all the time in my business.” The wedding coordinator started looking around and thinking of what to do with you. The wedding coordinator finally explained, “Hmm…This is highly unusual. It will look rather strange for an 8 year old girl wearing a flower girl dress to walk down the aisle with the maid of honor….”

The wedding coordinator grabbed another groomsman and said, “You will have to escort the maid of honor instead…” Next she grabbed your hand, “You are going to have to walk down with Amanda, just before the bride comes down the aisle. It will look more appropriate if the two girls wearing matching flower girl dresses come down the aisle at the same time! I have an extra basket you can carry too with flower petals so you can help Amanda spread them along the aisle…”

Amy seemed relieved that the wedding coordinator figured out a way for the wedding party to enter. Being a nervous bride, that was one less thing for her to worry about.

As the wedding coordinator hands you a basket of flowers, you start realizing your role of the best man has turned into the role of a second flower girl. After you finish the practice walk with Amanda down the aisle, you wonder how tomorrow will go.
115311.title: The wedding rehersal

1153111.content:
The next morning, Mr. Jones drops you off at Amy’s house. All the bridesmaids are there starting to get their hair done for the wedding. You ask Amy, “It’s 7 am? Why did you want me here so early?”

Amy explains with a sigh, “I suppose that’s a fair question since you are new to the whole ‘girl’ thing. The wedding is at 2pm and we have tons to do!...For starters, all of us girls need to get our hair and makeup done. That includes nails too! We have to be completely dressed by 1pm for pictures. Followed by final touches for the wedding! There’s my hair, 5 bridesmaids, and two flower girls that have to get this all done in less than 4 hours!”

You can tell Amy is a stressed out bride. You would have rather hung out with the groomsman all morning. You were curious to how the bachelor party went last night. You thought about what Amy just said and asked her, “Wait a second!? Did you say TWO flower girls? I’m the best man!”

Amy sighed, “I’m sorry. I know you are David’s best man. It’s just been easier to organize this hair and makeup session by classifying you and Amanda both as flower girls. The women I hired to do our hair and makeup needed a way to set everything out. My wedding dress, hair extensions, and makeup is all in the corner over there…All the bridesmaids stuff is along that wall, and yours and Amanda’s stuff is by the other corner. Don’t worry sweetie, everybody knows you are the best man! David wouldn’t want anybody else giving a speech at the wedding besides you!”

You feel somewhat relieved hearing Amy refer to you as the ‘best man.’ But you suddenly get a nervous feeling remembering about the speech! “Oh crap!” You thought to yourself realizing that you never wrote a speech. You were planning on using this morning to write it. You quickly find a pen and paper and sit down in front of your dress hanging on the wall next to Amanda’s dress. Just as you start writing, Amanda shows up and sits next to you. She is giddy and excited for today with her big role as the flower girl. As you try and write the speech, Amanda keeps talking to you causing you to lose your train of thought.

Eventually a woman approaches you and Amanda, “Hi girls! I’m Carolyn! I’m going to be doing your hair and makeup today! I’ll have you two girls looking just as beautiful as the bride today okay?”

Amanda wiggles her hands in excitement after meeting Carolyn. Carolyn notices your lack of enthusiasm as she asks, “What’s wrong sweetie? Aren’t you excited to get all dressed up for the wedding? It’s quite an honor to be chosen as a flower girl!”

You quickly interrupt her, “First of all, I’m not a flower girl! I’m just wearing the same outfit as Amanda because there wasn’t a bridesmaid dress in my size!”

The woman replied, “Oh…Okay..I’m sorry I didn’t know that sweetie. That’s really cute. What are you…about 7 or 8? I’ve never heard of such a young bridesmaid before. You should feel honored the bride chose you for that job! Are you her sister or something?”

You roll your eyes, “No, I’m best friends with the groom. I’m actually his best man. There was a mix-up at the bodyport company yesterday when I arrived. I ended up with this body instead of a guy’s body.”

Carolyn nodded with understanding, “Ahhhh…I see! Don’t worry honey, you aren’t the first man I’ve seen as a woman in a wedding. After years of doing hair and makeup for weddings i’ve seen it all with people using body-porting! I used to work in the Bahamas doing destination weddings. Due to the shortage of available bodies in such a tourist area, it was pretty common for body porters to end up in bodies of the opposite sex. And I’ve also seen plenty of men who chose to be ported into women’s bodies for weddings. I did a bridesmaid’s hair and makeup just last week who was actually a man. He was the brother of the bride. The bride really wanted him in the wedding, but there wasn’t room for another groomsman. So her brother agreed to bodyport into a woman to be a bridesmaid. He actually did a great job too!”

Hearing Carolyn’s explanation made you feel better about the situation. Carolyn finally said, “Ok girls! Let’s get started!”
1153111.title: The real wedding

11531112.content:
For the next few hours, Carolyn rotates between doing Amanda’s and yours hair. You try your best to work on your best man’s speech every time Carolyn focuses her attention on Amanda. With all the women constantly gabbing, you barely have time to write anything down. After getting your nails done, you couldn’t hold a pen while your nails were drying. Then almost immediately after, you got a light touch of makeup. You weren’t able to write with your face being worked on.

With less than an hour before pictures, Carolyn has you both get your white tights on. She then has you carefully step into a slip. As Carolyn buttons up the back, you ask, “Whoa? What is this? This wasn’t part of the dress I tried on yesterday?”

Carolyn explains, “You only tried on the outer shell of the dress yesterday to make sure it fit. This slip has an attached petticoat so your dress will flare and fill out more. You will see what I mean in a second…”

Carolyn then helps you pull the dress over and it falls into place over the petticoat. You are surprised at how much the dress flares out now. Carolyn ties the bow in the back and says, “Be careful when you sit down. You don’t want your dress accidentally poofing up. It’s only 11am so you will be wearing this dress until late tonight when the reception is over.…Make sure you sit down and rest when you can. These shoes might start to make your feet sore after wearing them all day. And don’t forget to have somebody help you go to the bathroom. It will take too long to unbutton this dress, so they will have to hold it up while you sit down on the toilet.”

After being educated on how to wear a dress, You mumble a reply, “Uh..Thanks…I guess that’s important to know…”

Carolyn gets Amanda into her matching dress, and you try to sneak in some more speech writing. Carolyn quickly grabs the pen out of your hand and says, “Sorry sweetie, but you can’t risk getting ink on your dress. You are going to have to just work on your speech in your head!” With barely anything written down anyway, you just toss your scratch paper into the trash. You are going to have to try and come up with something and try memorizing it from now on.

Next Carolyn pulls out two boxes of jewelry. “Luckily, the jewelry store was able to get a second set of these. Amy was relieved when she found out you two would have complete matching outfits!” You stand still as Carolyn puts a necklace on you and a pair of earrings. Finally, she pins both of your tiaras in and smiles, “All done girls!”

Now completely ready, you join Amy and the bridesmaids on the other side of the room. They all smile at you and Amanda telling you both how adorable you look. You tell Amy, “Since I’m done getting ready, Do you think somebody could drive me to meet up with David and the groomsman so I can see how they are doing? I wanted to talk with David before the wedding…”

Amy looks at the clock and shakes her head, “Sorry John, but according to my wedding schedule, all of us girls are leaving here shortly to meet the guys together. Don’t worry, you will have plenty of time during the pictures to talk with David!”

You know there isn’t any way to convince Amy to let you leave. She has been a nervous and anxious bride all morning and you don’t want to disrupt her strict wedding schedule.
11531112.title: Getting ready

115311121.content:
After getting ready all morning with the girls, you finally meet up with David and the rest of the groomsman for pictures at the church. Thanks to Amy having a last minute hair emergency, the girls were all 20 minutes late for pictures. The wedding planner and photographer quickly get to work positioning everybody for pictures. Everything happens so fast, that you barely have time to even talk to David. At first, you join all the groomsman in the ‘boys’ photo. The photographer has you step out for some pictures wanting to get just the guys in their tuxes. When the bridesmaids start getting their group pictures, the photographer asks you and Amanda to step in for some shots with only the girls. Then at the end of the photo shoot, they have you stand with Amanda for a few shots because you have matching dresses on.

It isn’t until everybody lines up for the procession that you get a chance to finally talk to David.

David winks, “Hi John!....Cute tiara!”

You roll your eyes, “I wasn’t originally supposed to even wear this stupid thing. But once Amy saw it on me she, she decided that she wanted me and Amanda to match. I decided not to fight it. You know how crazy brides can be before their wedding!”

David laughs, “Thanks for not causing any trouble!”

You then ask, “So how was the bachelor party last night?”

David replies with a big smile, “I’m really sorry you had to miss out on that!” He then whispers, “The strippers you set up for me were amazing!”

You are still sour about not being able to hang out with the guys last night. You then ask David, “Where’s Amy’s ring?”

David reaches into his pocket and hands you the ring, “Good thinking! I almost forgot about that! The best man always gives the groom the ring!”

You are glad you finally get to actually do a wedding task that is designed for the best man. You look at the ring and smile, “Nice job buddy! This must have cost a fortune!” Out of instinct, you try putting the ring in your pocket for safekeeping. You look down realizing the dress you have on doesn’t have pockets.

You start looking for a place to put the ring as John notices your problem. John finally says, “Hmmm…It’s probably easier if Roy (one of the groomsman) keeps it in his pocket. He’s the next groomsman in line. Just get it from him after we are in our places at the altar!...I’ll see you up there buddy!” David then goes to the front of the church just before the wedding starts.

With the wedding party ready to start walking down the aisle, the wedding planner hands you and Amanda a basket of flowers and says, “Okay flower girls….Remember to smile and spread these flowers out as much as you can! Except for the bride, you two flower girls have the most important job! Remember to walk slow so you don’t trip over your dresses!...”

As you take the basket of flowers from her, you say, “…Ahem…Amanda is the flower girl.! Remember that I’m just helping her out!”

The wedding planner says, “Oh yea! I keep forgetting that you are really the best man. Either way, you two have a very important job! Don’t forget to smile!”
115311121.title: Pictures

1153111211.content:
Before you know it, you and Amanda are going down the aisle spreading the flowers. You follow instructions and keep a smile on your face while cameras click pictures the entire time. As you approach the altar, the crowd all stands up and turns around to face the bride. Relieved that everybody’s eyes are finally off you and Amanda, you try to get into the ‘best man’ position next to David at the altar.

You are glad the groomsman left you space to stand as the best man. As you try getting into your place next to David, you realize your dress is so wide that it flares out too much. The wide petticoat gets in the way and you cant fit into your spot. You need some more room. As you try spin around to whisper to the groomsman to back up a few steps, your dress brushes against a row of candles. Luckily, the entire crowd is looking towards the back of the church and doesn’t notice the candles almost fall down. The preacher fortunately stopped the candles before toppling over. You try to get the groomsman’s attention again to back up, but they are all looking towards the bride and can’t see you. You know Amy will get mad if the wedding party doesn’t look good. You see that Amy is about half way down the aisle and will there soon! You quickly start looking for another place to stand and see one of the bridesmaids waving you over. You hope she has a good idea as you quickly and quietly slip over to the bridesmaid’s side. You whisper, “Where should I stand?”

The bridesmaid whispers back, “Amy is almost here! Just go stand with Amanda!” You go behind all the bridesmaids and stand with Amanda at the end of the line. You get there just in time so nobody notices anything was wrong. You are relieved you didn’t ruin Amy’s wedding procession. But now you are stuck at the end of the bridesmaid’s side with the rest of the girls. Your real spot as the best man should have been next to David. A few minutes later, the exchanging of the rings is about to happen. Now that you are so far away from the center of the altar, you start thinking about how you are going to get the ring from Roy, and then hand it to David? After all, as the best man, it is your job to hand the ring to the groom. Before you can decide on a plan, you see Roy hand the ring to David. From the end of the line, you just glare knowing your most important job was taken from you.

While waiting in line, you realized the need to check the woman's name. So, sifting through her small corduroy handbag (it having been slung around your shoulder this whole time), you found a driver's license and temporal ID to match. Violetta Marinaccio, age 34, 5 feet 2 inches, 115 pounds, brown hair, green eyes. Female. This will be you for the next two weeks.

"Hello? Your name and ID, please." A voice broke through your reverie. You found yourself at the counter, a clerk shuffling papers on the other side of the booth.

"Violetta Marinaccio." You replied slowly, hearing a mellifluous soprano voice flow out of your mouth.

The clerk chuckled, taking the identification cards and jotting down notes on paper. "Miss, that was a decent attempt," He explained. "But remember, for Italian surnames like that, the stress goes on the second 'a', before the double 'c'. Not after. MarinAccio, not MarinaccIO."
Sighing again, you wobbled out to the rental car, listening to your heels click against the pavement. You sat down, swung your legs in (making sure to adjust your dress from ruffling upward), and started the engine. Deciding it would be more comfortable to drive without heels, you kicked them off, discovering that the woman's nails, on her hands as well as her feet, were painted bright red.

The drive was uneventful and had minimal traffic. Thanks to mapping out Violetta's home address before entering the bodyport earlier that day, you knew where to go. What you hadn't anticipated was the height differential, as you really had to sit up straight to see around the car while driving. But soon enough you pulled into the driveway of a modest, single-story house with a grassy front yard and green hedges.

From looking though Violetta's handbag, you knew that she possessed a house key, garage door opener and cell phone, among small personal hygiene items like lip gloss, hair clips, perfume, and a tampon. Yet an important question remained: Is her husband at home right now? Will you have to introduce yourself to a Mr. Marinaccio right now?

14431.title: Yes, her husband is home.

14432.content:
You minced up to the front door and rang the doorbell. No answer. Although you had a house key, and were in a situation where nobody in the neighborhood would suspect otherwise, you felt like an impostor about to break into a random house. In a way, however, you were less of an impostor than the real Violetta would be in this moment. After all, you had her body, her credit cards (cross linked to your bank account), her voice, her husband, and her life. You debated whether or not to call "Jonathan Rivers" to make sure 'he' got home from the bodyport safely, or to give instructions on how to live that life for the next two weeks. But considering that nobody had called you since the transfer, perhaps it wasn't really necessary.

You opened the door and strutted inside the house. Thankfully nobody was inside and no cars were in the garage. You took time to examine the woman's life and, hopefully, find some less feminine clothing to wear when you met up with your high school friends later that day.

The living room was adorned with a television, pictures of friends and family, furniture and stationery, and a glass tabletop. The pictures drew your attention first. In one, a man and woman were posing together in a wedding photo. The man had jet black hair, rugged features, and wore a tuxedo. The woman, smiling brightly, wore a stately wedding gown with frilled sleeves. Her eyebrows were waxed and face delicately outlined with makeup and blush. In another photo, that same woman was cradling a baby in her arms, with both faces looking toward the camera. The photo appeared relatively recent. The baby had a wisp of blonde hair. You found it interesting that, not too long ago, the body you were currently wearing had conceived, became pregnant with, and bore the baby in that picture. Where was it now? With a babysitter, perhaps?

Other photos were of the man or woman's parents and friends. You got the impression that the happy couple had an involved social life despite entering parenthood. In the kitchen, a scribbled crayon drawing was on the refrigerator. In pen, and in much neater writing, it read "Emilia -- 3 anni." Dishes were in the washer and appeared dirty, so out of politeness you added solution and ran the washer. Tomatoes, bread, and wine rested on a granite countertop next to the glass table. You noticed a framed picture of a teddy bear holding the moon in a starlit sky; below it was an embroidered caption in Italian: "Non fare il passo piu' lungo della gamba, orsacchiotto!" Most books, papers, letters, and cards you found in the house were written in Italian and, therefore, indecipherable.

A few questions burned through your mind. Did this family recently immigrate from Italy, or have they lived here for a while? How well does this family speak English? Can Violetta speak English well? If she can't, how will that impact my life she is borrowing? What if I encounter her husband or daughter and cannot communicate with them? It was more annoying than shocking to discover that you had been transferred into a life with such a different background.

In the master bedroom where Violetta and her still-nameless husband slept, you found a walk-in closet and many drawers of clothing. Trying to avoid staring at her body too long, you manage to change out of her dress, underwire, and heels. You put on boyshorts (being the closest to men's briefs that you could find), struggled with getting in the hooks of a 38D bra, and slipped on a short-sleeved blue top and beige capri pants. Trading the height boost for better comfort, you opted for flip flops instead of heels. In addition, you removed the diamond wedding ring and placed it on the nightstand next to the bed. During the unavoidable inspection of your new body, you discovered a few small tattoos on your shoulder, thigh, and lower back. Flowers, a heart, and a the name "Lorenzo" in an elegant font. Your new skin was noticeably darker and smoothly shaved compared to your old body. Being 13 years older, your new body showed the beginning signs of aging.

Before meeting up with your friends, you decided to take advantage of the privacy by getting something to eat and using the bathroom. Needing to sit down in order to pee was a bizarre experience, having been just fine standing up to do the same job over the past 21 years. You almost forgot to wipe afterwards!

You grabbed the car keys and slung Violetta's handbag around your shoulder once again. Is it time to meet up with friends?
14432.title: No, her husband is at work.

choices: Let's see how Violetta is doing in your life
144321.content:
It was later in the afternoon by the time you drove over to your friend's house. Having mapped his location beforehand, you realized that he lived only a few miles from Violetta's house. It was no trouble driving there, but in retrospect it might have been wise to call them in advance about the 34-year-old Italian beauty claiming to be their friend.

Regardless, you found yourself driving through a neighborhood that could be described as exceedingly opulent. To call them "houses" would confuse something humble with what you encountered: a series of small mansions. Each one had an enormous front yard, cobblestone driveways, two, three, or four stories, 4-car garages, and had backyards gracing either the nearby golf course or a private lake. The property value could easily be in the millions of dollars. This couldn't be where one of your friends lives, could it?

You open Violetta's cell phone and dial your friend's number.

"Hello?" A young man's voice answered on the other line.

"Hey Shawn, this is Jonathan Rivers." You said while steering through the neighborhood. "Is the address you gave me correct? I'm driving through a neighborhood for filthy-rich people. That can't be you, can it?"

"That's no mistake, I really live here!" Shawn replied, the smugness evident in his tone. "And... dude... you sound like a chick! What happened?"

"Well, I went to the bodyport and---" You were interrupted by a guffawing Shawn. "Don't tell me, they swapped you with a random? That's hilarious! Was it your first time? Do you know how uncommon a gender swap at the bodyport is? You gotta get your ass over here pronto. Zach, Paul, and Matt are already here. We're waiting for ya buddy. Can't wait to see you!"

"You bet. Don't start the fun without me!" You chuckled and hung up. You found his house and three other cars parked in the driveway. Parking on the curb, you strolled up to the door and were greeted by Shawn.
144321.title: Go to friend's house

1443211.content:
You entered into the foyer of Shawn's mansion-like house. This was a moment you hadn't prepared for. For the first time, you felt rather insecure about your appearance in front of the friends you grew up with in high school.

"Heya Jon. Is that you in there? You sure have changed a lot since high school!" Shawn laughed, reaching out to shake hands. Not noticing how crushing his grip was in your petite hand, he continued, "Please, my house is your house. Make yourself comfortable and take a seat. I've got the grill on full blast with some steaks and burgers, and Kelly is preparing the rest." Before you could respond, your other three friends appeared and welcomed you into the house. And although you could sense their eyes wandering over your newfound figure, you dismissed it as something you would do if the situation was reversed.

However, two of the other three friends seemed... different. "Um, excuse me for asking but who are you guys?" You asked.

The tall man with a beard and wearing a bowler hat, plaid shirt, and jeans responded, "I'm Paul. Yeah, I used the bodyport earlier today and ended up as this guy. Not bad. He's a little on the fat side, but there's some good muscle tone to go with it."

The other man (or perhaps boy) looked to be about 12 years old and wore a Transformers t-shirt with khaki shorts and sneakers. "And I'm Matt. Nice to see you again Jon. Shoot, at least you ended up with an adult body. Unless we do it in private, there's no way I can legally drink. Or drive, or smoke..."

"You don't smoke anyways, Matt." Shawn mentioned.

"What if I wanted to start? This body isn't mine, who cares what happens to it after I switch back?" Matt retorted.

"I'm pretty sure you can't do that. Didn't you read the bodyport policy agreement? No committing your partner's life to destructive habits or activities." Warned Paul.

"The policy? You actually read that boring crap? I just signed it, gave it back to the attendant, and went on my merry way." Chortled Matt, as he blew a raspberry with the kid's lips.

"You know what Shawn? I think Matt's new body suits his personality better than his old body." Paul smirked. You all laughed at him while he grumbled and disappeared into the living room. You resumed going along to each of your friends and shaking hands or pound hugging them. Each time reminded you of how much smaller and weaker your form was in comparison to your previous stocky, 6-foot-4 frame.

Noticing that Zach was still his old self, you questioned why. He informed you that he preferred to avoid the bodyport and simply use his own car to travel to this meetup. It was a 14-hour drive on highways that are no longer being maintained by the government, but according to Zach it was worth keeping his own identity. He made reservations for one of the few remaining hotels in operation in the town. As it turned out, the rental car and hotel industries were not completely wiped out as predicted with the advent of bodyports. Some people, such as Zach, preferred the old way of transportation despite the additional cost and time spent travelling. Even though bodyports were popularized in society just 5 years ago, most people found them to be a convenient, fast, cost-effective, and safe alternative compared to airports or highways. And, thanks to an effective marketing campaign by government and private industry, people had no fears about making the switch (no pun intended).

You breathed a sigh of relief. Your friends were just like you remembered them, and they were accommodating to the circumstance surrounding your transfer. They might have teased you at times, but it was expected of friends who hadn't seen each other for over 3 years.

Shawn returned to the grill, Kelly (Shawn's wife) was in the kitchen preparing dinner, and you, Paul, Matt, and Zach sat on the leather sofa watching a (American) football game.

"So Jonathan," began Paul, glancing down at your legs, "Do you know anything about her? What I mean is: Have you had a chance to learn more about the life you'll be living for the next two weeks?"

"Of course. Her name is Violetta Marinaccio, she's 34 and lives about 10 minutes away from this house. She's married and has a daughter, but I didn't get the chance yet to meet them. I'm guessing that they came from Italy or something, since I couldn't understand half of the things in their home. It's possible that she doesn't even speak English." You explained, sharing attention between Paul and the football game on TV.

"It's possible, you say? Haven't you spoken with her over the phone yet?" He asked incredulously.

You shifted in your seat and frowned. "Well, not yet. But I plan to. Today has just been a busy day, and I wanted to give her space as she gets used to living my life. She hasn't called me either."

"Okay," relented your friend, turning his focus back to the TV. "Thought it might be a good idea, considering your situation. Anyway, the reason I asked is because I talked to my partner earlier today while you weren't here. You know, this guy I swapped with. His name is Edward Cunningham, works at the local university as a tenured professor. Thankfully he's on sabbatical right now so I don't have to fake my way through the next two weeks. He said he wanted to go on vacation and become someone else for a little while. He said he thought of it as 'spinning the roulette wheel' of life. A real nutter, this one. We shared information about each other, some of which I repeated here for you, and agreed to keep in contact at least once a day." Paul took a sip of beer and wiped his mouth. "This is my sixth time using the bodyport, so I'm pretty familiar with the whole process. Personally, I think it's amazing that you ended up as a woman on your first time. You can experience things that no man will ever experience. It can broaden your horizons, you know, give yourself a better understanding of the female species."

"You seem more positive about it than me." You interjected.

Paul laughed. "Yup! That's because I'm not the one wearing panties and getting a period. Don't sweat it, Jonathan. It's just for two weeks. Over before you know it."

"Hey, can you two stop flirting and get a room? The Packers just scored another touchdown." Matt interrupted. He took a swig of beer but sprayed it out in disgust. "Yuck! This kid's taste buds aren't used to alcohol. This sucks."

"So did you get a chance to talk to your swapping partner, Matt?" Zach asked to change the subject.

"Of course I did." Matt responded indignantly. His pre-pubescent voice seemed at odds with his mature mood and mannerisms. "Do you honestly think I'd let a kid run wild in my body? I told him to keep my pants zipped. If he does something stupid, I'm protected with a comprehensive insurance plan. The premium costs a crapton, but for these two weeks it's worth it." He set his beer on a coaster on the table. "The boy was going to see his grandparents for two weeks during the summer. With any luck, I'm gonna switch back with a mouth full of cavities, a totaled vehicle, and an arrest warrant."

You returned to the game. The time passed slowly as you nursed a light beer while waiting for dinner. It became apparent that your new body didn't like the rough, carbonated texture of beer. Oh well.

Then you felt a tap on the shoulder. It was Kelly Wilson, Shawn Wilson's 23-year-old wife. You attended their wedding as a groomsman (usher). Zach was the best man, but it didn't matter much after one hell of a bachelor party. Though it had been a few months removed, you found Kelly just as sexy and alluring now as then.

"Hellooo Jonathan!" She beamed, leaning forward in a way that showed off the impressive cleavage in her low-cut top. "I heard you arrive here earlier, but I was so busy making you guys dinner! Just slaving away in the kitchen. You'll love what Shawn and I are making tonight." She sighed, as she motioned for you to give her a hug. You got up and awkwardly embraced Shawn's wife, both of your breasts pressing together. It was weird and hot at the same time. While you had towered over her at the wedding, as Violetta you met her only at eye level.

"Uh. Thanks. The trip went fine. Do you need any help?" You said out of formality.

"Actually, I could use some help in the kitchen." Kelly answered, clasping your manicured hand tightly. "Come on Jonathan, if you're going to experience womanhood you'll need expert guidance. Let's leave the 'boys' to watch their silly football game. Plus, you need to keep me totally informed about this woman's life and family!"

You glanced back at your friends for help. They were chuckling with each other, of course. Matt said, "You should listen to Kelly. Proper women don't bother themselves with football games. Aside from the buff physiques and spandex tights, right Jonathan?"

"Just because I'm a woman doesn't make me gay!" You raged, as the others burst out laughing. Nevertheless, you allowed Kelly to escort you away from the living room. She appeared enthusiastic about showing you the ropes; after all, you were playing for 'the other team' now!
1443211.title: Continue this storyline

14432111.content:
Despite your reluctance to tag along with Shawn's wife, and desire to talk to your friends instead, you followed Kelly into the kitchen to help prepare tonight's food. Kelly tied on an apron, wiped her brow, and handed you a potato peeler.

"Do you mind boiling 5 or 6 potatoes in that pot over there, honey?" She asked. "Then let it sit, mash it up, add pepper and butter if necessary. Set it on the table along with silverware next to the gravy. Also, could you throw together a house salad? It doesn't need to be fancy. Just dice up some carrots, green onions, peppers, tomatoes, cucumbers, and use the lettuce in the bottom drawer of the refrigerator. You think you can do that Jonathan?"

You sighed and began preparing the side dishes. "You know Kelly, I'm sure most of this stuff isn't absolutely necessary for tonight. Take it from me, the guys would be happy enough without the frills." Referring to the garnish Kelly strategically placed on the plates, along with candles lit inside glass jars placed on the oversized mahogany dinner table beneath a chandelier suspended from the ceiling.

Kelly brushed off your comment, opening the stove to check on something. "You're just like Shawn! No understanding about nutrition. Didn't you take a cooking class in high school? An atmosphere of ease and gentleness is the best for digesting food. Beef is great for protein, calories, and the like, but you really need fibers, vitamins, and minerals from fresh produce. Anything we don't finish tonight will be leftovers tomorrow, although I suspect most of this will be gone anyways."

"Can't I spend time with the friends I haven't seen since high school?" You complained, washing the lettuce in a colander and placing a bowl next to the cutting board.

"Not until you help me with this." Kelly said resolutely. "I really do appreciate it, Jonathan. You might not be aware but it takes a lot of effort to prepare a dinner for 6 people. I've been consumed solely with dessert preparation for the past few hours. It's baked Alaska, my specialty. You'll love it! It's almost done right now. Here, help me get it out of the oven."

You stopped what you were doing to don some oven mitts and take the ceramic dish out of the oven. "Think you can handle that, sweetie?" Kelly snickered, watching you place the heavy dessert on the counter to cool.

"You're enjoying this too much." You grumbled.

"And why not? It's about time you men appreciate the finer art of food preparation." Kelly said. "In most households, it's always the woman responsible for keeping the family well nourished. Families rely on the wife, the mother, for something so basic. Without us, you would resort to macaroni and cheese or ramen noodles every night!"

"And what's wrong with that, exactly?" You retorted, placing your hands on your hips and cracking a smile.

"Because men should learn how to cook too. It's super attractive if a man knows how to cook and do other things around the house." Kelly replied. "That way, we women can drink beer and watch the football games for a change?"

You returned to dicing the vegetables and plopping the potatoes in boiling water. "That wouldn't interest you anyways."

"Speak for yourself, Jonathan." Kelly giggled. "See how much fun this is? You're getting a new perspective already!"

You decided to drop the conversation and focus on making the food as quickly as possible. It didn't take too long (mostly waiting for the potatoes to soften) before your contribution to the meal was complete. It was a large table with intricate wood carvings on the side. Its entire surface was filled with bowls, dishes, plates, condiments, silverware, and the food. Shawn came inside with the meat covered by aluminum foil. Setting that on the counter next to the table, he announced to the guys that dinner was ready.

"Finally, I'm starved!" Matt cried, being the first in line to gather food.

"Well, you're a growing boy after all. Literally." Zach rolled his eyes.

"These mashed potatoes are excellent. Not too flaky, just the right amount of flavor." Paul said, pouring more gravy over the top of a generous mound on his plate. "Thanks for the meal Kelly."

"Actually, you can thank 'Violetta' for that." Grinned Kelly. "She prepped for a few of the dishes on the table here."

"Is that a good thing or bad thing?" Chuckled Matt. "I won't be in the bathroom all night, will I?"

"Oh, stop it! I supervised Jonathan and made sure he did everything alright. With more of my guidance I think he could become a fine woman." Kelly replied, in a half-patronizing tone that made everyone laugh. "

"It's so good to see everyone again. Not in the flesh, ironically, but in spirit." Shawn added, slicing another chunk of steak to add to his plate. "Do you all remember Ryan? Ryan Ferguson? Last week I read on Facebook that he passed away after a hang gliding accident."

"He was the center on the high school basketball team, the year we went to the state championships." Observed Zach, the mood around the table becoming more somber.

"Is that true? Man, that's a tragedy. He and I had a psychology class together senior year. Not the sharpest tool in the shed, but he worked his ass off in everything he did. Made the most of life, you know? Nothing was out of reach to him. My condolences to his family; if I had a Facebook I would have attended the funeral." Paul said.

"How about a toast?" Proposed Kelly. "To making the most of life." Glasses clinked around the table, and you downed a glass of red wine in a heartbeat. Apparently, your body was conditioned to prefer wine over beer, as you enjoyed the dry taste of the Chianti.
14432111.title: Cooking with Kelly

144321111.content:
It approached that point in the meal where the clinking of silverware replaces talking. You, your friends, and Kelly ate and drank in a pleasant silence. But a question lingered on your mind and it had to do with Shawn's newfound affluence.

"Hey Shawn, I don't remember you being this loaded in high school. You've been prospering lately, no doubt about it. How did all this come to be?" You raised your hands, referring to the Victorian mansion they called home.

"That's right, you weren't here when I talked about that." Shawn said. Your other friends had evidently heard the story earlier. "It was shortly after graduating from high school. I had saved up about 2,500 dollars from my summer job working at Dave's restaurant. I considered taking out a student loan to go to college, but I didn't have anywhere in mind. I imagine that most students don't know what they want to study, and I knew that life wasn't for me."

"So what happened? This house isn't worth $2,500!" You exclaimed, pouring yourself another glass of wine.

"Just a minute, I'm getting there." Shawn answered. "Anyway, I ran into a friend I knew from Boy Scouts who I hadn't seen for years. He told me about some new digital currency called Cryptcoin. Said it was the future of money. He laid out a whole philosophy on the subject, but I primarily saw an investment opportunity out of it."

"One man's investment is another man's speculation." Muttered Zach.

"Quiet!" Snapped Shawn. "So instead of sinking my money into an overpriced, college educational system, I bought Cryptcoins. The price per coin at the time was a nickel, just five cents. $2,500 divided by $0.05 is fifty thousand. That was how many Cryptcoins I owned a few years ago. I'm sure you heard the news recently. I'd love the mass media if I didn't hate it, but their popularizing of Cryptcoins sparked a lot of interest from other users. The short story is this: I rode the speculative wave of investment until I sold all my coins at the peak price of $1,000 per coin. Off the top of your heads, anyone? Fifty million dollars. That's $50,000,000 of tax-free revenue. Naturally such a large trade made news headlines. Caveat emptor, that's my motto."

"Listen to Gordon Gecko over here..." Zach said.

"When you commit $2,500 of your life savings in a high-risk endeavor, then you can talk. Okay?" Shawn replied angrily. "Can you believe that, Jonathan? I make the best decision of my life and Zach can't see the forest through the trees. I provided a valuable service; by selling my supply of Cryptcoins, I drove down the price and signaled that I thought the price was too high. By selling them at that price, it meant that somebody else wanted to buy them. Somebody else thought that the price should have been higher than $1,000 per coin. When we discard the emotion and misinformation, it really was a simple transaction. Nothing more. No different than speculating in commodities or stocks or bonds or the final score to the Packers game."

"Let's change the subject." Said Paul quickly, eliciting a nod from you, Matt, and Kelly. "The main point is that you're thriving. Neither you nor Kelly will ever have to work again!"

"Here, here!" Glasses clinked around the table. Yet again, you found yourself downing a glass of wine. In your old body it took quite a lot of alcohol to get you feeling buzzed. As it turns out, you were starting to feel warm and relaxed a lot sooner than you expected. You noticed that your long fingernails clicked against the glass every time you raised it to drink. For some reason, this seemed peculiarly amusing to you.

"How many glasses of wine have you had, Jon? Might wanna go easy on that." Remarked Matt.

"It's no problem at all... I can drive back to this chick's place?" You stumbled over the words slightly. Kelly giggled.

"We were thinking you would sleep over with us tonight. That goes for you two as well, Paul and Matt." Shawn offered kindly. "Zach, we know you've already made hotel reservations, but the option is open for you too."

"Thanks, but I think I'll head back to the hotel soon. Gotta check my e-mail. I'll be teleworking for the next few days, since I can't afford to be away from my job for so long." Zach stated. "Some people need to be productive members of society."

"I think he's jealous about Shawn's wealth." Paul whispered to you parenthetically.

"Maybe you'll change your mind later this week, Zach." Said Shawn. "I'll be rigging up my yacht for a fishing trip to Conifer Lake on Friday. I want all of you to be there with me!" Referring to a large, freshwater lake about 35 miles outside of town.

Kelly's prediction about dinner ended up being a bit overstated. There was more food left over than anticipated, due partly to your own decreased metabolism. You felt full after eating just a hamburger and some salad. At least you didn't spill anything on Violetta's clothes.

"Anyone saved room for some baked Alaska?" Kelly chirped, setting down the plate of the sweet confection on the table after clearing off the main course. The guys did, naturally, but you couldn't say the same for yourself.

"I think I'm gonna -- hic! -- give Violetta a call." You said, staggering up from the table and stumbling on your feet, more out of unfamiliarity than drunkenness. "Where is her handbag? I mean... my handbag!"

"I set it on the desk in the study room." Kelly said, pointing out where that was. Wow. Kelly looked amazing in her strapless tube top. Her daisy dukes left little to the imagination, displaying her luscious legs in full prominence. You shook your head and went over to the study to retrieve Violetta's handbag and cell phone. It might be a good idea to call someone before the night is over. Who do you decide to talk to?

1443211111.content:
Whether it was the need to check in, or the alcohol encouraging you to do so, you wanted to call Violetta and ask about her life. You grab the cell phone, flip it up, and sit on the chair in the study. Rubbing one hand absentmindedly over your smooth legs, and using the other to dial your old phone number, you lean back in the chair and sigh.

A masculine voice answers on the other end of the line. "Hello? Who is this?" It asked.

"This is Jonathan Rivers. Well, I used to be, but now I'm a chick named Violetta Marinaccio. Would you happen to be that chick?" You said casually.

"Sì. Il mio nome è Violetta. Uh... Mine name is Violetta. You are Jonathan, yes?" You could tell she had a poor grasp of the English language. Your old voice was unsteady and had a distinct Italian accent to it.

"Yeah, listen. I wanted to call and see if you had any questions for me, since you'll be living my life for the next two weeks. It shouldn't be too difficult being me, because I don't have a job currently and I'm away from university for the summer. Do you understand all of this?" I asked in her lilting, airy voice.

"I... I... come si dice... repeat please? You repeat please?" She asked. You sighed. This was going to be harder than you thought.

"Do you have any questions? Do you need help?"

"No. No help." She responded. You rather doubted that, but continued anyway, speaking as simply and telegraphically as possible. "What about your life? What do I need to know? Tell me about your life."

There was dead air over the line, as Violetta must have been translating in her mind what to say. You thought you heard typing on a computer. Before long, she responded again. "I married a man named Lorenzo and have a daughter named Emilia. We moved emigrated from Tuscany to your country 2 months ago. My husband is an engineer and I stay at home to care for our son. However, she will be the nanny for most of it the next two weeks. Lorenzo knows that exchange. I called today."

Clearly she was using an online translator. Despite her resourcefulness, you couldn't help but feel sorry for her. Her husband was probably on an extended work detail that required him to move to an English-speaking country. Deciding not to split up the family (and deprive their young daughter from growing up without a mother or a father), they moved together. It is possible that Lorenzo spoke better English than his wife, and that they made enough money to allow her to be the homemaker and raise their child.

"Why are you traveling?" You asked slowly. "What do you want to do?"

Another pause. Clicking of keys on a keyboard. "To visit my sister Simonetta. I have not seen since left Italy 12 years ago." She read the resulting translation online, not understanding what it meant but having enough faith to use it anyway.

"Good. Maybe she can speak better English than you can." You stated matter-of-factly.

"Che cosa? No, she... Simonetta is italiano, no is English. Uh, spiacenti. Sorry." The frustration was apparent in her voice. "I have class of English... every day. I work in the language very good. You... you go to class, please? I need to go there."

"Okay." You shrugged your shoulders, figuring that there could have been more challenging obligations for her to drop on you for any reason. Going to her English-language class could be fun, and apparently it was required for Violetta to attend on a regular basis. info.description:
The year 2030 and five years ago scientists have revealed a new technology that, since then, has made airports a thing of the past. No longer do you have to travel by flight and waste precious hours up in the air. The future is now, with bodyports!

Bodyports are in the same buildings airports used to be, and serve exactly the same function. However, instead of using an airplane to travel, you switch bodies using one of thousands of terminals in the bodyport.

Bodyports are safe for all ages! 100% guaranteed safety.

To use a bodyport, you must first purchase your tickets, as you would with regular airports. You choose your destiation, and you will be given a list of people who you choose to swap with that live in that area you're planning on going to. The two of you then arrive at the terminals at your local bodyports, and a few button presses later by the attendants working there, and swap! You are given full access to the body's house and vehicles, where you will stay, thus making hotels and motels a thing of the past.

When you're done with your travels, just do the same thing, and a few button presses later, and you're back in your own body!

A disclaimer: Like airplanes, you may not always get the preferred seat, or in this case, body, that you have chosen.
So strap in, and swap!
